text: Un bon classic Italien avec de la nourriture extraordinaire! Je recommande le voeu parmesan! Mais toutes leurs sortent de pâtes sont absolument merveilleuse!

By far the best Italian restaurant in the city!  The setting is an old apartment that was converted into this gem of a restaurant!

The food is authentic Italian, and the portions are huge.  Their menu is extensive and the wine list is very good and everything is really affordable.  You won't find a better place for the price.  My favorite dish is by far The Eggplant Parmesan it is absolute perfection.

The place gets really busy on the weekends so you will have to reserve ahead of time.  It's great for groups, and if you can snag one of the back rooms for a group gathering, all the better.  It's a very intimate setting.

Bonjour, première. Fois que je vais manger e ce resto. La lasagne très bonne..  Et surtout. L'entrer de saumon succulent, ça fond dans la bouche,très bonne portion, petit pain à l'ai à volonté...  Resto très conviv 
iale, bon service, et la, tu peut vraiment relaxer et prendre ton temps pour déguster ton délicieux repas. Félicitation a toute l'équipe  du resto le COLBERT.

This restaurant has been a favorite of mine for about 20 yrs. I hadn't been here for about 7 years and it's just as delicious as ever.
Generous, delicious portions for a reasonable price. Authentic italian food, great service. This place is a gem!!!
La meilleure pizza en ville! Gros problème, peu importe combien de temps on commande d'avance, le take out n'est jamais prêt. Ils attendent de nous voir avant de mettre la pizza au four.

Très bon rapport qualité prix, des portions généreuses et la nourriture est bonne. Pains a l'ail et marinade de tomates offerts en entrée, délicieux. Le service est très bon et rapide. Pour plus d'intimité, des rideaux séparent les tables sur les cotes. Bonne adresse a garder.

Très bonne nourriture. Bon prix et bel ambiance. Ça vaut le détour.

Sections privés pour souper à 2 ou 4. Très charmant.

A friend and I were looking for a good meal and i had remembered a restaurant i had gone to a long time ago and i was very pleased with the meal.

Years later and i have to say they only improved with time.

It started with bruschetta and garlic bread
The owner suggested the special of the day which came with salad or pasta (with olive oil and vegetables)
We both agreed to have the special... lobster tail with large shrimps.

Need i say more.

I'm guessing the decor hasn't changed since 1963 but why change something that works.  

Seriously.. 2 thumbs up

Never go to this restaurant! It's one of the worst places I've ever been to! The staff is rude and unprofessional! The crowd is loud and the food is nuked in the microwave and should be considered fast food. With the selection of restaurants in this city, this should be last on your list! Don't bother! Stay home.

On y a été pour les 30e d'un ami. L'anniversaire était organisé par une famille italienne, alors on s'était dit que ça devrait être bon. Les entrées de la table d'hôte étaient corrects. Nous avons essayé une salade et un plat de gnocchi avec du poulet. 

Ce qui m'a déçu est mon plat de thon. J'ai demandé à ce que le thon soit saisi rapidement seulement. Le serveur est arrivé avec deux plats de thon et a demandé c'était pour qui le thon "bleu". J'ai jamais vu un thon aussi cuit. C'était très sec. Le serveur n'a pas pris la peine de revenir à la table avant la fin du repas. 

J'ai mis trois étoiles, car nous étions un gros groupe et la nourriture a été servie dans un délai très raisonnable. Malheureusement, je n'y retournerai pas.
The food here is very good and the prices are excellent. I had the fettucine carbonara for only $11 and it was amazing. Highly recommended if you're looking for good food at a decent price

Solid Italian joint! My husband and I ordered take out the first night of our vacation from this neighborhood spot and were pleased. 

We split an order of fettuccine bolognese and a small pizza. The pasta was good and tasted like it should. The pizza was a bit on the thick side to be called truly authentic, but it definitely got the job done.  

The prices were truly affordable and the atmosphere, when I stopped in to pick up the food, seemed familiar. It was warm with families eating in their own curtained off alcoves. I wouldn't hesitate to stop back in to discover what the house specialties are!

Truly authentic Italian cuisine. Every dish packed with flavor. Tomato sauce tasted like true home made tomatoe sauce packed with flavors. Nice warm and cozy ambiance.Warm and friendly service...every dish served with a warm smile. Had the tortellini with rosee sauce...wonderful taste. Great meal and very reasonable prices

Bon petit resto italien. Honnetement, tout est pas mal bon et assez authentique: les pâtes et pizzas, autant que les assietes de viande. Je vous recommande le veau il est particulièrement bon. Ce n'est pas très cher et le service est excellent. En plus, il y a des tables pour couple très intimes avec des rideaux et ils acceptent les reservations de groupe avec menu table d'hôte.

We'd been wondering about this cute sprawling old Italian restaurant since friends of ours moved in down the street. The white lights, the sign "Since 1964" the caricature cutout all made the outside seem like either a total family-friendly find from another time or a potential frozen food fail. But come Valentines a bunch of us got dolled up and went to try it out. And we were not disappointed! The calamari and eggplant parma were the biggest hits I think, huge inexpensive portions with nice fresh flavour and textures. The house wine was tasty and affordable, the garlic bread came with fresh bruschetta, and the service was just as you'd wish - friendly and smooth and helpful and not overly obtrusive. Cozy, filling and easy going - highly recommended for families in the area.

My family and I really enjoy this quaint little Italian restaurant not far from where we live. It has been in the neighborhood since the 60's. Judging by how crowded it is even on a week-night, it clearly has a strong fan base amongst its patrons. We really enjoy coming here for dinner; the food is delicious, the service is fast and friendly and the convivial ambiance makes me feel as though I have been invited to a family friend's home for dinner. Recently we discovered Chez Colbert's wonderful pizzas to-go! Now we are here even more often! Why go to Double Pizza when you can come here and have a much, much better pizza made with much higher quality ingredients for the same amount of money?

Le Colbert is an Italian place located on Jean Talon and Christophe Coulomb.  I ordered the table d'hote so I started with a salad and then finished up with grilled sausages served with a side of spaghetti arrabiata.  The food was all pretty good but I must say the arrabiata sauce wasn't that arrabiata in the sense that it wasn't very spicy.  the sausages though were quite good.

The decor is a little dated but the service was reasonable and the prices are nice and cheap.  In all it's worth the visit if you want a restaurant meal but don't feel like breaking the bank.  The quality of the food is right for the price.

Un de mes restaurants préférés quand j'ai envie de manger de l'italien. J'y suis allé 4-5 fois avec des ami.e.s et en famille, et le propriétaire m'a facilement reconnu dès la 3ème fois. J'ai toujours droit à un accueil chaleureux. 

La pizza Spécial Colbert vaut vraiment la peine. Les prix sont très raisonnables. Parfois achalandé même en semaine, donc si vous y allez en soirée, prenez la peine de réserver pour avoir une place confortable.
